p: Over the past decades extensive efforts have been made to develop new drug alternatives in endemic countries. In general, a wide range of antileishmanial plant extracts have been evaluated as evidenced from Iran ( Bahmani et al., 2015), French Guiana ( Rocha et al., 2005), India ( Samuelsson and Bohlin, 2017), Israel ( El-On, 2009) and Greece ( Fokialakis et al., 2007). There seem new approaches toward the natural products, in absence of effective agents would be a logical strategy ( Harvey et al., 2015). Unfortunately; although, despite the use of natural products in endemic countries only a limited effort has been made to isolate and analyze their chemical antileishmanial compositions to conduct clinical trials.
